intro: Romulea vanzyliae, commonly known as the Vanzyl's gladiolus, is a species of flowering plant in the Iridaceae family. It is native to the Western Cape province of South Africa, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, with a distinctive spurred petal. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
